body: Hi, I am getting strange results from the v.58 cumulativeSkyMtx component when I run the Reinhart skypatch model. See attached files and images. The Reinhart model reports an error saying it cannot read the weather data, yet it creates a skydome that is almost reasonable. Strangely, the Reinhart sky has lower values over the hourly sunpath lines.  I ran this all using the attached cumulativeSkyMtx module, which should have been updated to resolve an issue with the latest radiance release based on your another post.   The Tregenza sky model calculates fine, but might not be pixelated enough to show the issue that appears in the Reinhart model. Do you know what is going on?   As always, I'm a big fan of your work! Thanks for your help with this. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/mQNS8aIZyEvNeJC2ukjqWCrJWFxw4K33YTzQPaG5ZbqG0DA7nKWdVidnKaIitCrA0lQniL924BFrJu8C1MVMUnQ6YATYF*D2/cumSkyReinhartstrangeoutput.jpg) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/mQNS8aIZyEsOs2Yu6Y9SdE0tA1pBbWqbLYRni0cURzTE55wOM3dYbAUQTNo1J2eRAcnKhW5YxEYrIVqxtiN-YaZV3utOCtft/cumSkyReinhartstrangeoutput.jpg) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/mQNS8aIZyEsOs2Yu6Y9SdE0tA1pBbWqbLYRni0cURzTE55wOM3dYbAUQTNo1J2eRAcnKhW5YxEYrIVqxtiN-YaZV3utOCtft/cumSkyReinhartstrangeoutput.jpg)
